intro: Canthium rupestre, commonly known as the rock canthium, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Canthium rupestre is often found in rocky or disturbed soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
